intro: Corydalis acuminata subsp. hupehensis, commonly known as the Hupeh Corydalis, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China, particularly in the provinces of Hubei and Sichuan. The plant features slender stems and produces delicate, spurred flowers in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
